intro: Geum parviflorum var. albiflorum, commonly known as whiteleaf avens, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves with a distinctive white or pale green coloration. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded woodland environments. Due to its unique foliage and delicate flowers, it is a valued addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
